coventrytelegraph.net - Danny Thompson • 4h

author: Noticias RCN
title: Vuelve el FPC: ¿cuándo debutan Nacional, Millonarios y América?
text:
Vuelve el FPC: ¿cuándo debutan Nacional, Millonarios y América?
A partir de este viernes regresa la acción oficial en el fútbol colombiano. Prográmese con los debuts de los tres grandes del país.
Sergio García
04:46 p. m.
Unirse al canal de Whatsapp de Noticias RCN
El fútbol profesional colombiano regresa a la acción luego de un mes de inactividad tras el título obtenido por Atlético Nacional a finales del 2024 y la ilusión parece estar renovada para los hinchas de los equipos inscritos a la Dimayor y que estarán disputando el torneo a partir de este viernes 24 de enero con el objetivo de coronarse campeones.
Nacional fue el equipo que consiguió los títulos tanto de Liga, como de Copa en el 2024 y el conjunto verdolaga quiere volver a tener hegemonía en el rentado nacional, por lo que para este 2025 fichó nuevas figuras esperando retener los trofeos en sus vitrinas.
Atlético Nacional, el máximo favorito
Los antioqueños son quienes parten como los máximos favoritos para la Liga 2025, pues más allá de que sorpresivamente cambió de entrenador y ahora estarán comandados por el argentino Javier Gandolfi, el actual campeón del FPC mantuvo la mayoría de sus jugadores e incluso se reforzó en algunas zonas, por lo que se espera que tengan gran protagonismo en el torneo local.
El debut de Nacional para este 2025 oficialmente será frente a Once Caldas en el Atanasio Girardot.
- Nacional vs. Once Caldas
- Fecha: sábado 25 de enero
- Horario: 7:30 p.m. (horario colombiano)
Millonarios, con más dudas que certezas
Luego de cinco años de un proceso con Alberto Gamero al frente, Millonarios por primera vez disputará un partido oficial con otro entrenador en el banquillo.
David González llegó a Millonarios luego de haber disputado la final de la Liga con Deportes Tolima y aunque el cuadro ‘embajador’ no mostró muchas cosas nuevas durante la pretemporada que jugó en El Campín, se espera que para su debut frente a Unión Magdalena, el elenco de la capital de la República deje ver mejoría en su fútbol ante la espera de si se renueva a Radamel Falcao García o no.
- Unión Magdalena vs. Millonarios
- Fecha: viernes 24 de enero
- Horario: 8:10 p.m. (horario colombiano)
América de Cali, a la espera de JuanFer Quintero
América de Cali tampoco tuvo una buena pretemporada en la capital de la República, pero más importante para los hinchas, es que después de semanas de espera, el cuadro escarlata no ha logado anunciar a su fichaje bomba Juan Fernando Quintero.
Han sido semanas de mucha ansiedad entre los hinchas del América por el fichaje de Juan Fernando Quintero. Sin embargo, la institución escarlata aparentemente no ha logrado finiquitar detalles con Racing Club y su debut en Liga claramente lo tendrá que hacer sin el ‘10’ dentro del campo del Olímpico Pascual Guerrero.
- América de Cali vs. Llaneros
- Fecha: sábado 25 de enero
- Horario: 5:00 p.m. (horario colombiano)
Unirse al canal de Whatsapp de Noticias RCN

author: TVA Nouvelles
title: EN VIDÉO | Une mère magasine au Walmart avec son enfant habillé que d’une couche en hiver; l’employée qui la dénonce renvoyée | TVA Nouvelles
text: Une femme affirme avoir été renvoyée du Walmart après avoir dénoncé sur les réseaux sociaux une mère qui magasinait dans la succursale aux États-Unis avec son enfant en bas âge habillé que d’une couche en hiver. Dans l’une des vidéos publiées dimanche sur le compte Facebook de l’utilisatrice Fee Nicole, on peut observer un garçon dans un panier grelotter alors que le mercure est descendu sous la barre du 0 degré Celsius à Jackson dans l’État du Mississippi la semaine dernière, selon les informations de Wunder Ground obtenue par le New York Post. On peut entendre une femme hors champ critiquer le choix de la mère affirmant que le garçon «ne peut pas être ici sans manteau». «Le bébé ne porte qu’une "Pamper"», poursuit une autre femme. Un homme ajoute que l’enfant «est assis et grelotte». La mère, qui prend mal les critiques, continue de faire son magasinage et lance nonchalamment un sac de frites congelées sur les jambes de son fils dans le panier; une action qui lui attire de nouveaux reproches. Ces derniers annoncent ensuite leurs intentions d’appeler la police, une proposition qui éveille la colère de la mère qui lève le ton avant de quitter la rangée en faisant une dance arrogante. Dans une seconde vidéo, on remarque que le garçon a été habillé par une autre cliente dans la rangée des réfrigérateurs alors que la mère est fixée sur son cellulaire. La femme qui a filmé la vidéo aurait toutefois été punie pour cet acte. «Oui j’ai été renvoyé! affirme Fee Nicole dans une publication sur Facebook. J’ai été renvoyé en raison de la vidéo... Vous pouvez en dire ce que vous voulez. Dans l’instant, je pensais au pauvre enfant!» La femme soutient toutefois que malgré la mauvaise nouvelle, elle va toujours «bien» et que son «réfrigérateur est rempli de nourriture».

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: New Zealand E-Visa Program Expands to Welcome Brazilian, Canadian, Japanese, Mexican, and Portuguese Citizens | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: In a significant move to enhance global connectivity and tourism, New Zealand proudly announces the expansion of its E-Visa program to include citizens from Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal. This strategic initiative aims to simplify the visa application process, promote cross-cultural exchanges, and strengthen diplomatic ties between New Zealand and these diverse nations. New Zealand, renowned for its stunning landscapes, rich Maori culture, and vibrant cities, has long been a sought-after destination for global travelers. The introduction of the E-Visa program has proven instrumental in facilitating smoother entry for visitors, eliminating bureaucratic hurdles, and providing a more efficient means of obtaining travel authorization. Since the implementation of the E-Visa program, New Zealand Visa for Brazilian citizens now have the privilege of applying for New Zealand visas online. This electronic system expedites the application process, allowing Brazilians to experience the wonders of New Zealand for tourism, business, or any other purpose seamlessly. The move aligns with New Zealand's commitment to fostering global partnerships and extending a warm welcome to visitors from diverse corners of the world. A New Zealand Visa for Canadian Citizens , New Zealand Visa for Japanese Citizens , New Zealand Visa for Mexican Citizens , and New Zealand Visa for Portuguese Citizens is not optional, but a mandatory requirement for all these citizens traveling to the country for short stays. Before traveling to New Zealand, a traveler needs to ensure that the validity of the passport is at least three months past the expected departure date. The E-Visa application process is designed to be user-friendly, allowing citizens of Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal to navigate the platform with ease. The online application form captures essential details, streamlining the process and eliminating the need for traditional paper-based applications. This digital transformation not only enhances efficiency but also aligns with the global trend toward digital visa systems. The E-Visa platform facilitates the seamless submission of required documents, reducing the burden on applicants. From proof of identity to travel itineraries, the digital system ensures that necessary documents are submitted electronically, eliminating the need for physical paperwork. This not only saves time but also contributes to a more environmentally friendly visa application process. One of the notable advantages of the E-Visa program is the expedited processing time. Unlike traditional visa applications that may take weeks, the digital platform aims to provide quicker turnarounds. This is particularly beneficial for individuals with imminent travel plans, ensuring they receive their New Zealand E-Visa promptly. The expansion of the E-Visa program to include citizens from Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal underscores New Zealand's commitment to fostering global connectivity. This initiative goes beyond facilitating tourism; it serves as a bridge to strengthen diplomatic bonds, promote cultural understanding, and enhance international collaborations. As New Zealand extends its E-Visa program to encompass citizens from diverse nations, a warm Kiwi welcome awaits travelers seeking to explore the country's beauty, culture, and opportunities. The E-Visa initiative aligns with New Zealand's values of inclusivity, innovation, and sustainability, setting the stage for a new era of seamless international travel. The expansion of the New Zealand E-Visa program reflects the country's global vision for travel. By embracing digital advancements, New Zealand aims to provide a more accessible, efficient, and transparent visa application process. As citizens of Brazil, Canada, Japan, Mexico, and Portugal embark on their journeys to New Zealand, they are invited to partake in the enriching experiences that await them in this land of unparalleled beauty and hospitality. Media Contact Company Name: New Zealand Visa Application Contact Person: Janet Edwards Email: Send Email Country: New Zealand Website: newzealand-visa.org/visa/

author: @chr.mk
title: Хинштейн навестил в больнице детей, раненых при обстреле курского посёлка Марьино | Society | Seldon News
text: Врио курского губернатора Александр Хинштейн навестил детей, которые пострадали вечером 10 июня во время обстрела ВСУ в посёлке Марьино Рыльского района. Для Владимира, Михаила и Анны организовали лечение в областной больнице, уточнил глава Соловьиного края в своём Telegram-канале. К счастью, у всех трёх ребят нет серьёзных травм. У Ани выявили небольшие осколочные ранения, у Миши сильный ушиб пальца, у Вовы - ушибы и небольшие ссадины. С детьми поработал специалист-психолог. Ребята уже просятся домой. Договорились, что если 12 июня они будут чувствовать себя хорошо, то их отпустят на... Copyright information of photo and video materials was taken from the website «MK.RU Chernozem region» , more details in our Terms of Service

author: Herald Reports
title: OneGen Away expands partnership with Darrell Waltrip Automotive to support single moms in Midstate | Local News | williamsonherald.com
text: A whopping 73% of single mothers in Tennessee are economically insecure, according to a [Think Tennessee](https://www.thinktennessee.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/190909_fact-sheet_-working-families-and-economic-security_final.pdf) study. It’s a startling statistic that One Generation Away (OneGenAway) and Darrell Waltrip Subaru are committed to addressing through a new initiative known as the Single Moms Fund. The Single Moms Fund expands upon a decade-long partnership between OneGenAway and the Darrell Waltrip Automotive Group that has helped feed more than 800,000 families through annual events like the Drive Away Hunger Challenge and Easter and Thanksgiving food drives. This new initiative — which was kickstarted with a $12,000 donation to OneGenAway by Darrell Waltrip Subaru — will provide not only nutritious food but also access to resources that will help these women achieve stability and self-sufficiency. "Together, we can provide the opportunities these mothers need to build a better future for themselves and their children,” said Chris Whitney, founder and executive director of One Generation Away. “We believe that every family deserves a chance to thrive, and this expanded partnership with the Darrell Waltrip Automotive Group allows us to offer even more support to single moms in our community.” According to 2022 U.S. Census Bureau data, Tennessee ranks 15th nationally in the number of households led by single mothers. The majority of these households face significant challenges, from balancing work and childcare to managing household finances, underscoring a critical need for community support. “Having grown up with a single mom, this issue hits especially close to home for me,” said Jimmy Harris, general manager of Darrell Waltrip Subaru. “When I took this position, I knew an initiative like this was going to be important, and One Generation Away is a perfect partner for the Single Moms Fund.” To make a tax-deductible donation to the Single Moms Fund, visit [onegenaway.com/donate](http://onegenaway.com/donate). Every dollar donated to OneGenAway translates to five meals. To learn more about OneGenAway and its upcoming Mobile Pantry events, visit [onegenaway.com](http://onegenaway.com/).

author: CME Group
title: Q2 2024 Agricultural Update
text:
In this report
[Agricultural futures and options thrive with a strong start to the year](#thrive) [Agricultural options on the rise with record quarter](#ag-options) [Are you missing out on soybean market opportunities?](#soybeans) [Price uncertainty in Livestock markets spurs increase in risk management activity](#livestock) [Access to CME Group Livestock Price Indices Data is changing](#indices) [Lumber future and options see a surge in liquidity](#lumber) [A new way to manage fertilizer risk: Urea options](#urea)
Subscribe to get the latest updates
Agricultural futures and options thrive with a strong start to the year
Strong growth in
[Agricultural futures and options](/markets/agriculture.html) continued from 2023 into Q1, giving traders more ways to manage risk across their portfolios. Average daily volume (ADV) was 1.6M contracts, surpassing the 2023 Q1 ADV by 15%. This trend appears to be continuing, with this month already on track to be the second highest April ever for futures and options ADV.
Agricultural options on the rise with record quarter
[Agricultural options](/trading/agricultural/agricultural-options.html?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo) closed Q1 with the best quarter ever, averaging over 337K contracts per day.
Continued growth in volume and open interest can be seen across a number of Agricultural options products such as Soybeans, Livestock and Short-Dated New Crop options. This upward trend shows how clients continue to use options to manage ongoing risk.
Are you missing out on soybean market opportunities?
One of the most common spread trades in the soybean market is the crush spread. The crush spread is the difference between the value of soybeans and its byproducts like meal and is considered a gauge of the potential profit margin for soybean processors. Learn about soybean crushing with our recent whitepaper.
Futures and options on
[Soybeans](/markets/agriculture/oilseeds/soybean.html?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo), [Soybean Meal](/markets/agriculture/oilseeds/soybean-meal.html#venue=globex?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo) and Soybean Oil – as well the Soybean crush – provide a means to manage this risk as well as to take advantage of potential profit opportunities.
Price uncertainty in Livestock markets spurs increase in risk management activity
Supply fluctuations, production costs and anticipated seasonal demand are contributing to price uncertainty in the Livestock markets. That, in turn is, driving more trading activity across Lean Hog and Cattle products as producers and Ag traders seek to manage risk:
[Lean Hogs](/markets/agriculture/livestock/lean-hogs.html?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo): Operational improvements have participants turning to futures and options to manage price uncertainty, with ADV of 81,018 contracts and open interest of 714,213 contracts moving towards 2019 highs. [Feeder Cattle](/markets/agriculture/livestock/feeder-cattle.html?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo): Producers have found hedging opportunities, pushing ADV in Feeder Cattle futures and options to a combined all-time high of 24,361 contracts. [Live Cattle](/markets/agriculture/livestock/live-cattle.html?utm_source=none&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo): Participants are using futures and options to express their views on price levels, ADVs to 97,797 contracts – another quarterly record high.
Livestock Price Index data available now on CME DataMine
Take advantage of complimentary access to CME Group Livestock Price Index text file data and related files via CME DataMine, our self-service historical data platform. These files were added to DataMine starting in mid-February to give customers an alternate way to access equivalent files ahead of April 27, the date when the files will no longer be available via our FTP site.
Get more details about these changes in our FAQ.
Lumber future and options see a surge in liquidity
[Lumber futures](/markets/agriculture/lumber-and-softs/lumber.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo) (LBR) surpassed 10,000 open interest in Q1, with OI out to November 2024. Lumber futures ADV was over 900 contracts in February 2024 and 1,000+ March MTD, and we are consistently seeing 1 – 3-tick wide markets ($13.75 per tick).
The average daily notional volume in February was over $15M or 25M+ board feet and over $17M March MTD.
Futures ADV is up by 700% YTD followed by an increase in options by 130% YTD.
Market participants continue to spruce up their risk management strategies using Lumber futures and options, contributing to this overall growth.
A new way to manage fertilizer risk: Urea options
Capitalize on enhanced risk management capabilities with
[new options on Urea futures](/markets/agriculture/fertilizer/urea-granular-fob-us-gulf.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ags_q2_2024&utm_kxconfid=vpwpdpbbo). Additionally, the physically delivered futures contract now settles to daily (rather than weekly) Profercy and ICIS price assessments, to help better reflect price changes in the dynamic fertilizer market.
All examples in this report are hypothetical interpretations of situations and are used for explanation purposes only. The views in this report reflect solely those of the author and not necessarily those of CME Group or its affiliated institutions. This report and the information herein should not be considered investment advice or the results of actual market experience.
